posts.author: Xymos
posts.content:
1. PvP
2. 40
3. Dwarf
4. Fighter/Rogue/Dwarven Defender
5. Dual Rapiers or Rapier/Towershield
6. Dex bow
7. Rapier
8. +5 armor, +5 weapon
9. none
10. With this build I want to get Epic dodge, maximize the tumble, heal, discipline, hide and move silently skills. I want the best attack bonus possible,(weapon focus, epic weapon focus, weapon specialization, epic weapon specialization) but also would like to get epic damage reductions if possible. Dexterity, Intelligence and Constitution are very important.

Thanks for your help!

Well, Hide and Move Silently are good skills, but in the early levels, you don't rely much on them simply because you're setting traps and you have too many fighter / dd levels, meaning you can take on things head rather than through stealth. Hide isn't useful without MS and MS isn't useful without Hide, and having sub-par totals in both of them isn't of much use either, at least on WoG. That's why I left the skillpoints to place later, when I could at least reach a total that could make a difference, when Search is already where it needs to be and more skillpoints are left per level-up. But you can go ahead and take those skills whenever it's possible, although there is a chance you'll end up not using them at all.

One thing, though, Empyre, I would change that last Epic Toughness feat at 39 for EWF Longbow for +2 Ranged AB.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
With these builds, it is possible to put points into Hide and Move Silently from the very beginning without delaying any other skill, as I demonstrated. Because I am no expert on PvP, I do not question your strategy of waiting until later to use stealth, but I see no point in needlessly saving points instead of using them when you have the opportunity to do so.
